data.meta_site_name: Long Brothers Fine and Rare Books
data.text:
New York: Farrar Straus an d Cudahy, (1957). Johannes Troyer (dust jacket illustration). First Edition. Hardcover with Dust Jacket. 8vo. Pp. xxxiii, [3], 4-254. Translated by H. R. Hays. Preface by Eugenio Florit. Bound in bright green cloth with black lettering and a gilt flourish stamped on the front board, silver lettering stamped on spine. In the illustrated dust jacket that shows slight darkening to spine; price of $4.75 intact on front flap. Near Fine / Very Good+. Item #6580

A collection compiled and edited following Jiminez being award the 1956 Nobel Prize for Literature. While the works, both prose and poesy, are "selected," some material is first printed here. A handsome copy, with the dust jacket now housed in a removable, clear archival sleeve.
